definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: The saucy little girl from Hartford promptly corrected his idea.
sentences.chinese: 活潑爽直的哈特福德姑娘馬上修正他的主張。

sentences.english: In fact, the straightforwardness and portability renewed my appreciation for working with tape.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，爽直和可移植性再次感謝與磁帶。

sentences.english: Bll that were simple, straightforward, free, we had more two friends.
sentences.chinese: 一切就恁地簡略，爽直，隨心，咱們多了兩個伴侶。

sentences.english: Excuse me -- for I must speak plainly.
sentences.chinese: 我說話爽直，千萬要請你原諒。

sentences.english: And in today's depressed world, that policy is, to put it bluntly, predatory.
sentences.chinese: 在今天衰退的世界，這種政策是爽直的，掠奪性的。

sentences.english: As a gift, chopsticks symbolize straightforwardness because of their shape.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一份禮物，筷子就如他們的外形一樣象徵着爽直。

sentences.english: Introverted nature, peculiarly firm disposition, frank and vigorous individuality, are what you possess.
sentences.chinese: 性格內向，氣質獨特堅強，個性爽直潑辣。

sentences.english: My deskmate is a saucy little boy, his name is Guan Boyuan.
sentences.chinese: 我的同桌是一個活潑爽直的小男孩，他叫關博元。

sentences.english: They saw him often, and to his other recommendations was now added that of general unreserve .
sentences.chinese: 她們常常看到他，對他讚不絕口，又說他坦白爽直。

sentences.english: Look at that clear crisp sky, just like the straightforward, easy-going people of the North.
sentences.chinese: 看這個天，多麼晴爽乾燥，正象北方人那樣爽直痛快。

definition: frank and outspoken (idiom)/straight speaking/to say what one thinks
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
